page.title: 17 MARTLESHAM CREEK
page.content: Martlesham Creek is a muddy inlet of the River Deben. The River Fynn drains into the Creek. In the mud about twenty small yachts are moored. They float for one hour each side of high tide. You can walk all round the creek and watch the shelducks searching for food and the moorhens in the reeds.Living on the reeds are lots of snails, perhaps they like the moist atmosphere.Reeds are used for thatching. Only 500m. from the creek there is an old {Suffolk Pink} house thatched with them. Nearby is the Martlesham Sewage Works. There are four big cleansing tanks, to our surprise there was no bad smell! We could smell the pigs from the piggeries. 1000 sows produce up to 20 piglets each year which are sold at local markets for meat.
